{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3328329,"name":"John Fogarty","username":"JohnFogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-09T03:08:25.145Z","cooked":"

We are using an SW-005 network switch to connect our rio to our radio and limelight. This switch has a 3 pin electrical terminal block with V+, V-, and an Earth ground. We only wired up the Postiving/Negative to our PDH.

While in our shop practice has been fine, but at an actual event on the real field we’re experiencing wild micro disconnect events where the robot disconnects 2-3 seconds at a time 10-20 times in a match. We’ve checked for any other source of the issue, but the thing that finally worked was removing the Brainbox switch from the network and running without our limelight.

Is the earth ground supposed to be used in an FRC application?

Has anyone else experienced an issue like this?

We are seeing this as well, and with slow connection times to the field on initial connection to the FMS. We are generally not having to many issues with it on the practice field or in our lab space. Investigating it a bit more to see if we can figure out what is going on

Edit: Update from Great Northern Regional today. We set all devices, (our two Limelights, RoboRio and Driver Station) to static IP addresses and that solved a huge amount of our issues. Our latency is back down this morning to the normal levels we have been seeing, as well as we have been seeing a lot less packet drop during the match. We are still seeing a delay when connecting to the FMS. We are working with the FTA to see what could be causing this.

ive heard from people that brainboxes are a YMMV situation. ours was abused last season and its still going strong so far, no disconnects and using its built-in voltage regulator

(id attach a picture but i dont have one - imagine brainbox with melted vhb tape, dye fluid, and one screw mount broken off)

FYI,

What we’re seeing is exactly same as this from 2 years ago.

Robot disconnection at competition Technical Discussion
Hi, In our last competition (Israel International Offseason), we had a problem where our bot disconnected for a second or two and then reconnect, repeatedly for a short time. This happened for about half of our games. It is not happening in our practice field at home. After the competition at home we reconfigured our radio and tried to play with the bot, for hours, including bumping into things, and a “full match”. We looked into our bandwidth and it is looking good around 8000-12000 bytes…

We were having the same issues during practice. We are using the earth ground I believe. We fixed the issue by plugging the switch into a VRM instead of directly into the PDH. We haven’t seen the issue since.

Splash3015:

We fixed the issue by plugging the switch into a VRM instead of directly into the PDH. We haven’t seen the issue since.

Very interesting data point. I think what this could point to is while the BrainBox switch has a very wide “unregulated” input range, and thus clearly has an internal regulator, that regulator may not have enough decoupling and isolation to deal with the amount of noise seen on the power rail in a FRC robot, so some of that noise is leaking through and disrupting the internal switch circuitry. The VRM adds a whole extra layer of noise isolation and thereby solves the issue.

58 can confirm. We were having ~3 second issues (RSL would go solid) after shooting a note. Replaced every component, one at time, including wiring. Brainbox was last component swap out. No problems after changing with a cheap ol’ network switch. I hate troubleshooting via component swapping but sometimes it’s all you can do.

Hey 1807 here with the same issue at our event. Tons of small, less than 3 second disabling’s while running a brainbox setup. Swapped brainbox for a new one and same issue. Swapped RIO for new one and same issue. For our very final match of the day, we connected the rio directly to the radio through the notoriously unreliable radio port number 2 and the robot worked beautifully (POE for the radio and the limelight’s still going through switch.

Do you have a link to the cheap switch you used that worked? If not, how should we select one that will work well?

148 was experiencing some brownout & minor comms issues (Comms loss for 2-4 seconds) today. After seeing this thread, we thought it might be Brainbox related. We are running power to Brainbox out of a VRM, but thought that the comms issues may still be the Brainbox browning out. We were only losing connection for about 2-4 seconds, so definitely not a radio reboot/power issue.

Adjusting the Stator current limits on the drivetrain to be more conservative helped to mitigate brownout issues and we have not had any connection drop-outs since that push.

Just another data point

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":47,"updated_at":"2024-03-10T03:18:54.208Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":18,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":423,"readers_count":422,"score":124.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":457986,"topic_slug":"brainbox-ethernet-switch-question-match-issues","display_username":"marshall","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":20021,"username":"Chadfrom7226","name":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17672,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team Principal"},"post_url":"/t/brainbox-ethernet-switch-question-match-issues/457986/19","custom_user_title":"Team Principal","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3328843,"name":"Joshua J","username":"thatnameistaken","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/57b2e6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-10T03:19:05.329Z","cooked":"
MSacca1807:

For our very final match of the day, we connected the rio directly to the radio through the notoriously unreliable radio port number 2 and the robot worked beautifully

This is not a legal setup, and shouldn’t pass inspection at your next event. The RIO must be in the first radio port, directly or through a switch, per R703. But it cannot go in the second. If the switch was in the second port, that’s fine, but based on this next bit it sounds like it wasn’t:

MSacca1807:

(POE for the radio and the limelight’s still going through switch.

This is confusing to me, and never should’ve passed inspection if I’m interpreting it correctly (not sure I am). Can you further describe your POE setup? What exactly is it powering, and where is the power for these devices coming from?
